featured.text: Only a few centimeters in length, the fish breed easily in captivity, grow quickly, and their transparent body makes it easy to study their organs.
Scientists thus hope that understanding the self-healing mystery of the fish may one day allow humans to regenerate such organs as eyes, hearts, and spines.
Recent studies show that humans and zebrafish have the same major organs and share 70 percent of the genes.
Although scientists have not been able to solve all the mysteries of this amazing organ, they have made some progress.
These include not only external behavior, but also all the organs, the whole skeleton, every single bone and tooth.

definition.zh_def: 器官；生物體內的功能性結構。
definition.en_def: A part of an organism that is typically self-contained and has a specific vital function.
definition.example: The heart is a vital organ that pumps blood throughout the body.
